Adult (American).description: Black-crowned Night-Herons have shorter legs, that in flight don’t extend as far past the tail as they do on Yellow-crowned Night-Herons.

Juvenile.description: Immature Black-crowned Night-Herons have larger spots and bolder streaks compared to the Yellow-crowned’s smaller, more distinct spots and streaks. They also have a pale yellowish (not black) bill.

Adult/immature.description: American Bitterns are more likely to be found in reedy freshwater marshes than Yellow-crowned Night-Herons. They also lack the boldly spotted upperparts of immature night-herons.

Adult.description: Adult Green Herons are darker and more richly colored in green and reddish tones than the gray Yellow-crowned Night-Heron.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Green Herons are redder on the neck than juvenile or immature night-herons. Green Herons are also smaller with a thinner bill than Yellow-crowned Night-Herons.
